How to Install sigma-align on debian

  • Home
  • debian
  • sigma-align

Today in this tutorial, I’ll show you how you can install sigma-align on debian with and without using the command line.

Introduction

Installing sigma-align on debian is very easy. And with the help of this tutorial, you will be able to easily install, update and uninstall sigma-align in just a few steps.

In this tutorial I’ll show you four methods to install sigma-align, the methods are using apt, apt-get, aptitude, and synaptic. All these methods require you to have an active and stable internet connection and sudo permission.

Install sigma-align Using apt

To install sigma-align in debian using apt, you will need to run the apt update command first to get the updated list of packages from the repositories.

Copy the command given below and paste it in the command line, then press enter. If you are using the sudo command for the first time then you might also need to enter your root password.

sudo apt update

After you have updated the package list using apt, you can now install sigma-align using the apt install command. To do that use the command given below.

sudo apt -y install sigma-align

The installation of sigma-align might take a little bit of time depending upon your internet connection and machine configuration.

Install sigma-align Using apt-get

To install sigma-align using apt-get in debian, you will need to first update the package list using the apt-get update command. Copy, paste, and enter the command given below in the command line.

sudo apt-get update

After updating the package lists, use the apt-get install command given below to install sigma-align.

sudo apt-get -y install sigma-align

Install sigma-align Using Synaptic

To install sigma-align using Synaptic you will need to first install Synaptic, you can do that by following the instructions from here. After installing synaptic follow the steps below to install sigma-align on your debian using Synaptic.

You can open synaptic by clicking on the menu icon then searching for synaptic or you can open the command line and enter the command given below –

sudo synaptic

After synaptic opens, click on the search icon and search for sigma-align. This will display the sigma-align package in the package window, now to install sigma-align, click on the checkbox that is on the left side.

Then click on Mark for Installation, this will select the sigma-align package for installation, now to install it click on the Apply button, you will get a summary window where click on the apply button again to start the download of sigma-align.

If the download and installation are successful then the checkmark option will turn green.

Install sigma-align Using aptitude

To install sigma-align on debian using aptitude, you will need to first install Aptitude in your debian. To install Aptitude follow the instructions here. Once you have aptitude installed proceed to the installation of sigma-align.

Now you will need to first update your package lists from the repositories, use the apt update command for that, after that update the package list of aptitude using the aptitude update command.

sudo apt update sudo aptitude update

After updating the package list of aptitude, install sigma-align using the command aptitude install sigma-align.

sudo aptitude -y install sigma-align

How to Upgrade sigma-align on debian

If you want to upgrade the sigma-align package on your debian to its latest version then here’s how you can do that using apt, apt-get, aptitude, and synaptic.

Upgrade sigma-align using Apt & Apt-get

To upgrade sigma-align to its latest version using apt or apt-get, you will need to open the terminal then run the sudo apt update command to update the package list, after that copy and paste the commands given below to upgrade sigma-align.

sudo apt install --only-upgrade sigma-align sudo apt-get install --only-upgrade sigma-align

Upgrade sigma-align using Aptitude

To upgrade sigma-align using aptitude you will need to again run the update command to update the package list, use command sudo aptitude update to do that. After that run the command given below to upgrade sigma-align.

sudo aptitude -y full-upgrade sigma-align

Upgrade sigma-align using Synaptic

To upgrade sigma-align using synaptic open synaptic using the command sudo synaptic or by going to the menu and searching for synaptic.

In synaptic click on the reload button, this will look for updates. After that you will need to search for sigma-align, now right-click sigma-align, and click on the mark for upgrade option.

Now to upgrade sigma-align just click on the apply button, then click on the apply button again in the summary screen.

How To Uninstall sigma-align on debian

If you want to remove and uninstall sigma-align from your debian then here’s how you can do that. To remove just sigma-align, you can use the command that is given below, copy the command, paste it in the command line then press enter.

sudo apt remove sigma-align

Remove related packages, dependencies & configuration files of sigma-align

To remove all the related packages, dependencies and configuration files of sigma-align you can use the command given below.

sudo apt -y purge sigma-align

Remove sigma-align using Synaptic Package Manager

You can also uninstall sigma-align using the synaptic package manager, first open synaptic using the command sudo synaptic or search and open it directly.

After that in synaptic search for sigma-align, right-click the sigma-align package and click on the Mark for Complete Removal option. Now to uninstall sigma-align click on the apply button then in summary click on apply again.

Conclusion

That is how you can install sigma-align on debian using the command line or using the synaptic package manager. I also showed you how you can uninstall and upgrade sigma-align using the command line or using the synaptic package manager.
